oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1942-12-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 12, 1942. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach, Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys and Blue Grass Quartet, Pap's Jug Band, Mac McGar, and Howdy Forrester. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Recording begins with the end of the previous Opry segment, sponsored by Carter's Chicks.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Rachel Veach
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Announcer closing statement -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys and Girls -- Get Along Home Cindy (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- California Blues (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Bashful Brother Oswald and Rachel Veach -- Little Pal (Bashful Brother Oswald, Rachel Veach) -- Prince Albert commercial (George D. Hay, Louie Buck) -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff -- Maple On The Hill (Roy Acuff)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Bashful Brother Oswald; Veach, Rachel; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Pap's Jug Band; Wilson, Lonnie; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; McGar, Mac; Monroe, Bill, 1911-1996; Blue Grass Boys
